intro: Congea tomentosa var. oblongifolia, commonly known as the hairy congea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, often found in moist, disturbed soils. Its leaves are ovate to oblong in shape, and the flowers are arranged in clusters at the base of the plant. It is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in herbal medicine.
